title: site
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

# Hi, neighbor! I‚Äôm Trey. üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I am running for your neighborhood board because I‚Äôd like to help our community tackle some of our most pressing issues, including homelessness, traffic, and jobs. I‚Äôm also eager to hear about your hopes and concerns‚Äìyou can always reach me at trey@gogordner.com.
I believe that my experience as an advocate for affordable housing, urban planning researcher, and small business owner can help our community grow more sustainably and create more opportunity for our residents.

About/Trey‚Äôs Story
Trey learned the importance of public service at an early age from his parents, an Army officer and a teacher. He has 4 younger siblings

military brat
husband/parent
civic technologist

Issues/Priorities

Smart Growth
As a trained urban planner and experienced local housing advocate, I know that continuing to pave over Ewa‚Äôs prime agricultural land is not the right solution to Hawaii‚Äôs housing affordability crisis. I will advocate for dense, mixed-use development in town and along the rail line to house more people while minimizing the impact on traffic and the environment.


Homelessness
Research has shown that homelessness is primarily a problem of housing supply and affordability.


Economic Development
Ewa needs more jobs. Instead of forcing ourselves and our neighbors to sit on the H-1 for hours every day, we should be creating high-paying opportunities in our own community. As a former small business owner and economic development researcher, I look forward to working with local businesses to grow and expand.

üó≥Ô∏è How to Vote
Voting begins April 28 and ends May 19.
In Neighborhood Board elections, voting is online-only at this website: https://web1.hnl.info/nbe/starter. Registered voters will receive a passcode in the mail.
For more information, visit the official Election FAQs.
Am I in Ewa 23? Check this Map.
